result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Travis A. Pourchot-Hein was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: AODA AND COMPLY WITH ANY RECOMMENDATIONS.

01/04/2016 Court approved defendant serve this sentence in Outagamie, Oconto, Manitowoc or Adams County
4/19/16:  Amended to allow defendant to serve the remainder of his sentence in Marathon County Jail.

ORDER FOR IGNITION INTERLOCK EXEMPTIONS AND REMOVING TITLE TRANSFER STOPS
Associated with Charge #1
Associated with Charge #1

Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Defendant to enter plea to Ct 1.  State will move to dismiss Ct 2 along with charges in 14TR1705.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Defendant enters No Contest plea to Ct 1.  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court questions Atty Gumz.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1.  Count 2 and charges in 14TR1705 are ordered dismissed.
Counsel waive the PSI.  Counsel make sentencing arguments.  Defendant makes statement.
BY THE COURT:  
Sentence withheld, defendant placed on probation for a period of 36 months with the following conditions:
*Serve 12 months in the Marquette County Jail with huber.  Sentence to commence forthwith.  *Granted good-time credit.  *AODA and comply with any recommendations.  *36 month DL revocation.  *36 month Ignition Interlock.  *Pay $1,000.00 fine plus costs for a total of $2,248.00 (includes DNA surcharge).  *Submit DNA sample.  *Cash bond on file to be applied to fine and costs.
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Plea hearing at 12-02-2015 02:30 pm

Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Gumz received the Amended Criminal Complaint and waives it's reading.  Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Court questions defendant as to his waiver.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
State files Information.  Atty Gumz received the Information and waives the reading.  Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Return date scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz appearing by telephone.  Defendant Travis A. Pourchot-Hein in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Gumz filed a motion to modify the bond and the State is not objecting to hearing that motion today.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will waive the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived; set for Prelim.

Atty Gumz states motion to modify the bond and asks to reduce the cash bond to $900.  
Atty Hendee objects to the modifcation of the bond and requests the bond remain the same.

BY THE COURT:  Court will reduce the cash bond to $1,000 cash with all the same conditions.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
